title: wrong current directory

labels.name: docs
labels.description: A problem or enhancement in documentation

body:
### What happened?

I am running this github workflow

```
      - name: Build
        run: go build ./...

      - name: Test
        run: go test ./...

      - name: Set up QEMU
        uses: docker/setup-qemu-action@v3

      - name: Release Test
        uses: goreleaser/goreleaser-action@v6
        with:
          args: release --clean --skip=announce,publish,validate
```
but the docker build fails with `pattern ./...: directory prefix . does not contain main module or its selected dependencies`

To confirm the build locally first I tried `docker buildx build -t testimage:arm64 . --platform=linux/arm64` which works.

It seems the content of `/app` directory (the directory of go build) just does not contain the expected copy of the source code when building via `goreleaser`.

And fair enough. `ADD . /app` seems to copy the wrong resources.

```
RUN ls -la
#10 0.040 total 11756
#10 0.040 drwxr-xr-x    1 root     root          4096 Jun  5 17:25 .
#10 0.040 drwxr-xr-x    1 root     root          4096 Jun  5 17:25 ..
#10 0.040 -rw-r--r--    1 root     root           448 Jun  5 17:25 Dockerfile
#10 0.040 -rwxr-xr-x    1 root     root       6381720 Jun  5 17:25 oci-resolve
#10 0.040 -rw-r--r--    1 root     root       2769070 Jun  5 17:25 oci-resolve_0.0.1_amd64.deb
#10 0.040 -rw-r--r--    1 root     root       2862832 Jun  5 17:25 oci-resolve_0.0.1_x86_64.apk
#10 0.040 -rw-r--r--    1 root     root            31 Jun  5 17:25 passwd
```

I seems `goreleaser` starts the docker build from the wrong directory. Which means that `.` is not the root of the project.

### How can we reproduce this?

https://github.com/tcurdt/oci-resolve

commit 377a1fb
